intro: Onobrychis ptolemaica, commonly known as Ptolemaic burclover, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Onobrychis ptolemaica is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which makes it beneficial for soil fertility.
